fields.description:
When attempting to compile the enclosed app I receive the following errors. This has been since I installed 3.1.3. I can get Hello World to run if I manually start the emulator and keep trying.


[ERROR][Vold    (   32)] ASEC FAT mount failed (No such device)
[ERROR][VoldConnector(  278)] NDC Command {6 asec create smdl2tmp1 16 ext4 [scrubbed] 10027 1} took too long (1512ms)
[ERROR][PackageHelper(  731)] Failed to create secure container smdl2tmp1
[ERROR][DefContainer(  731)] Failed to create container smdl2tmp1
[WARN][ActivityManager(  278)] No content provider found for permission revoke: file:///data/local/tmp/app.apk


Enclosed logs and app. ..... Sorry, the ticket would not let me add the zip of the app.

Thanks,
Ron
CSTG
fields.summary: ASEC FAT Mount failed (no such device), NDC Command took to long, smd12tmp1 failed
fields.environment: Windows 7 on I5 HP 16 gig ram, Android 4.3, Titanium Studio 3.1.3

comments.body:
Hello,

this is an error in your native android setup. It's likely you need to do your emulator's SD card bigger. 

Please check this:

http://stackoverflow.com/questions/5744298/what-does-this-mean-failure-install-failed-container-error

Best,

Mauro
